ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Other zoning bugs
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok, now that s a bug I ve never seen.  What an idiot GM though.  It is not common for orcs to spawn above the lift, wth is that?  I ve spent the first 10
ygData.messageBody:
Ok, now that's a bug I've never seen. What an idiot GM though. It is not
common for orcs to spawn above the lift, wth is that? I've spent the first
10 levels of 6 different characters on 3 servers in GF and have never heard
of orcs spawning above the lift. What color is the sky in this guy's world
that he doesn't think that's a bug? Does he live in the OOT where the
compass is all messed up? Has anyone ever heard of this before? By that
reasoning no one should ever get rezzed when found dead at a 'safe point',
'cause "its fairly common to find dead bodies at a safe point". I can just
imagine this guy's response to petitions like "I'm trapped in the cat room
can you get me out". Oh, no sorry, its pretty common to get trapped in the
'cat' room, look at all the npc's there.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 2:21 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Other zoning bugs


This was my second petition. First was at 6th lvl
when Orc Centurians were spawning atop the Orc lift
in Klelthin. We retreated from Orc Hill because the
volume was too much for us. Kept getting faction
messages even tho we weren't fighting any more....got
to the bottom of the lift and rested. Kept getting
faction messages.

The guards at Kelethin are a bit dense...we were
attacked again and again. We moved to the top of the
lift....kept on getting faction messages.

Resting at the top of the lift, faction messages
continued. Cents were spawning among us and
attacking.

My petition was answered by GM Traikis who told me:
"It's fairly common for orcs to spawn above the lift."

I was not impressed.

The faction messages continued until we all died and
then the orcs stopped spawning around us


--- "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...> wrote:
> I've been quite lucky. I've never had problems
> getting GMs to answer
> my petition/satisfy my problems.
>
> Maybe I have an honest face?
>
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Kimes, Dean W.
> [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> >Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 12:59 PM
>
> >That's what I thought too, but apparently the
> teleport spot for
> >Butcherblock
> >is at about 10,000 ft. You immediately fall and
> take 10,000 points anyhow
> >which is as you can guess instantly fatal. Not
> good when you are bound in
> >Halas at the time as I was. The GM's never
> responded to my petition even
> >though I was beneath the world and was supposedly
> teleported to a "safe
> >spot"
> >
> > Kit
>
>
